meanings.definition: A former Dutch coin worth five cents.
meanings.sent1: In the past, people used a stuiver to buy bread.
meanings.sent2: I found an old stuiver in my grandfather's collection.
meanings.sent3: I tried to pay with a stuiver at the store, but they laughed at me.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny stuiver, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the stuiver dropping into the jar echoed in the quiet room.

meanings.sent1: He only had a stuiver left after spending all his money.
meanings.sent2: She saved every stuiver she earned in a piggy bank.
meanings.sent3: I wouldn't bet a stuiver on that horse winning the race.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were worth more than a stuiver to the company.
meanings.sent5: The beggar's cup rattled as people dropped in their stuivers.
